intro: Syncalathium sukaczevii, commonly known as the Sukaczev's syncalathium, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in temperate regions, often in mountainous or forested areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
